bill_title: to limit the recovery of certain damages in cases involving the commission of felonies or certain traffic offenses.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit the recovery of certain damages in cases involving the commission of felonies or certain traffic offenses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. In any action for damages based on negligence, no person may recover any damages if the plaintiff's injuries were in any way proximately caused by the plaintiff's commission of any felony, or immediate flight therefrom and if the plaintiff has been duly convicted of that felony. Section 2. Except as provided in section 3 of this Act, in any action to recover damages arising out of the operation or use of a motor vehicle, no person may recover noneconomic losses to compensate for pain, suffering, inconvenience, physical impairment, disfigurement, or any other nonpecuniary damages if any of the following apply: (1) The injured person was, at the time of the accident, operating the vehicle in violation of § 32-23-1 and was convicted of that offense; or (2) The injured person was the owner of a vehicle involved in the accident and the vehicle was not insured as required by the financial responsibility laws of this State; or (3) The injured person was the operator of a vehicle involved in the accident and the operator cannot establish financial responsibility as required by the financial responsibility laws of this State. Except as provided in section 3 of this Act, no insurer is liable, directly or indirectly, under any policy of liability or uninsured motorist insurance to indemnify for noneconomic losses of a person who has been injured as described in this section. Section 3. If a person described in subdivision (2) of section 2 of this Act was injured by a motorist who at the time of the accident was operating a vehicle in violation of § 32-23-1 and was convicted of that offense, the injured person is not barred from recovering noneconomic losses to compensate for pain, suffering, inconvenience, physical impairment, disfigurement, and other nonpecuniary damages.
